title: Epstein's correspondence reveals links to French public figures
subhead: Millions of emails released by the US Department of Justice reveal the financier's relationships, some more intense than others, with several figures from France's politics and culture.

title: The 'Washington Post,' legendary American daily, is shaken by mass layoffs
Macron sends his diplomatic adviser to Moscow
'Canada, better the 28th EU member than the 51st US state'
subhead: The Canadian prime minister has called for an alliance of middle powers to stand up to the world's great powers. This is a compelling idea, and one that Europe has been pursuing for 60 years, writes Le Monde columnist Pascal Riché.

title: Pieter Mulier appointed Versace's new creative director
subhead: The Prada Group has chosen the Belgian designer to inject new energy into the fashion house it acquired in late 2025. Before officially starting his new role on July 1, Pieter Mulier will present one last collection for Alaïa at Paris Fashion Week in March.

title: Six Nations: France faces Irish challenge in tournament opener
subhead: After struggling in recent months, the French men's rugby team opens its defense of the Six Nations Championship on Thursday against Ireland. The match offers a major test for Fabien Galthié to fine-tune his squad ahead of the 2027 Rugby World Cup.

title: This French territory off the coast of Canada has 'no clear sense of worry' over Trump
subhead: Elected representatives in Saint-Pierre-et-Miquelon, the only French overseas territory in the North Atlantic, home to 6,000 people, aim to deepen ties with their major partner, Canada, amid growing geopolitical tensions with the US.

Ukraine's 'grandfathers' go to war
subhead: The Ukrainian army has an average age of 45, significantly older than European standards. The draft has targeted men between the ages of 25 and 60, which contrasts with recruitment practices typically seen in Western countries.

title: Between Putin and Trump, a similarity born of hatred, contempt and revisionism
subhead: Both ideologically and in the methods they used to achieve their goals, the Russian and American presidents display common traits that are cause for grave concern for democracy across the Atlantic.

title: Marine Le Pen's 2027 presidential bid further jeopardized by prosecution at her appeal trial
subhead: By requesting a five-year ban on election to public office on February 3, the prosecution has fueled doubts about Marine Le Pen's ability to run in the 2027 presidential election. The appeals court is due to rule on the case by the summer.

title: The end of US-Russia nuclear treaty is a dangerous signal for deterrance
'Trump put liberal democracy in the crosshairs in 2025, he might pull the trigger in 2026'
Luuk van Middelaar: 'With Trump, Europe is suffering an ideological assault from its historic protector'
